claim: Red blood cell formation is assisted by the presence of Vitamin B-12.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Vitamin B deficiency alone will not cause the syndrome in the presence of sufficient folate , as the mechanism is loss of B dependent folate recycling , followed by folate-deficiency loss of nucleic acid synthesis  (  specifically thymine  )  , leading to defects in DNA synthesis .

claim: Red blood cell formation is assisted by the presence of Vitamin B-12.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In the process of erythropoiesis  (  red blood cell formation  )  , reticulocytes develop and mature in the bone marrow and then circulate for about a day in the blood stream before developing into mature red blood cells .

claim: Red blood cell formation is assisted by the presence of Vitamin B-12.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Folic acid supplementation in the absence of vitamin B prevents this type of anemia  (  although other vitamin B-specific pathologies may be present  )  .

claim: Red blood cell formation is assisted by the presence of Vitamin B-12.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The defect in red cell DNA synthesis is most often due to hypovitaminosis , specifically a deficiency of vitamin B and/or folic acid .

claim: Red blood cell formation is assisted by the presence of Vitamin B-12.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Red blood cell distribution width  (  RDW or RDW-CV or RCDW and RDW-SD  )  is a measure of the range of variation of red blood cell  (  RBC  )  volume that is reported as part of a standard complete blood count .
